For this price i havent been expecting much anyway.

there wasn't any riddle to solve, the content in this game is very low and you will be through the entire game in less then 10 minutes.
if i would count all the aspects this review would continue 10 more pages probably.

- very low content ( short game time )

- assets are very low budget
- no convincing horror concept

reviewText:
Disillusions is so incomprehensibly hokey, so bizarrely cheesy that, as a hardcore horror movie fan, I want to love it. I really do. But this is a walking simulator and a bad one at that.
The controls go a long way towards that conclusion. With WASD unavailable for movement, you're forced to use the arrow keys to navigate and the mouse to turn which wouldn't be a major problem if you didn't also have to use E and Q. Do me a favour, pop one hand on your arrow keys then one on your mouse. Now try and reach either E or Q. What's even worse is that Q is sprint, rendering it effectively useless unless you can jog on the spot. Which you can't.
The plot is a mess, the characters are irritating and the multiplayer is one of the most baffling looking things you will lay eyes upon in some time. Maybe the only decent thing I can say about it is that for ¬£0.79, you can experience the unintentional hilarity of the Hat Mannequin Death House, where limbless wooden horrors bob for apples, kick trash bags around and throw hammers at you with their mouths.

reviewText:
Yech. While not an enjoyable game, it certainly has the atmosphere down pat!
I dunno, maybe I am just the type to be easily scared?

All the while I was playing this, I couldn't tell if I was in immenent danger for making the wrong decisions (like Slenderman, for example) or if the game was a haunted house experience. The fact that it wasn't clear was annoying, but at the same time, not knowing just added to the tension.

The voice acting is a little too loud and lacks any emotion at all, relating to the character portraits. If I were to change something about the game, it would probably be just the voice acting, which would be better if it was at least recorded with a better microphone.

.Music - A little repetitive. Definitely spooky - 7/10
.Sounds - Convincing, scary and well timed - 10/10
.Art - Somewhat limited character portraits. Decent character art style. 3d art is pretty standard for a home made Unity game. Well furnished environments. - 9/10
.Story and Progression - Unconvincing and repetitive. Doesn't seem to be the focal point. - 5/10 (taking into consideration that it isn't focal)
.Voice acting - Terrible. Down right terrible. All lines in the game are voiced, but it is way too loud and emotionless. The recording quality is terrible. - 2/10 (points for fully voiced)

I didn't get to experience the Occulus Rift features because I don't own the hardware. No doubt I would have ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• myself if I had tried playing like that.

Reveiw as of completing the first chapter only. 14/15 events triggered. (I mised the tree on the other side of the wall).
I give the first chapter a 7/10 for overall experience. (not quite the same as the average of the other scores).

Not a remarkable game, but the price you pay for it won't leave a sting in your pocket. You'd buy a candy bar for as much, and enjoy it for just as long.

reviewText: I don't really understand the negativity regarding this game. To me, it's simple but enjoyable enough. You get a lot (an upcoming multiplayer option, trading cards, etc.) considering the low price. And although the game is terribly short, it produced a few good jumpscares and includes a decent little twist at the end. The anime-style art and the backgrounds weren't exactly refined, but they were effective. I also appreciated the effort put into including voiceovers, which was a nice touch. I just wish the voice actors were a little more expressive because it would help add to the overall experience. My biggest complaint, really, is the length of the game itself. It would be great if they could include more chapters in the future, or perhaps even implement some kind of mod capability via the workshop to expand the story and game a bit more. Basically, you are getting what you pay for, and I was not disappointed.

reviewText:
I played game for a total of about 35 minutes, however steam does not count offline time :/


I got this as a gift...so yeah..here's my review..

So I started playing this game in English at night, with brightness up and headphones (as recommended). The game manages to have some pretty good atmosphere and the Manequins can surprise and scare you at times. The game is also pretty short with 3 chapters that took me about 25 mins (ish).
I also had some technical problems (I think) as my character kept slowly walking backwards for some reason.

Now, I noticed that the game let you choose the language at the start, and so I decided to play it in German. The walking-backwards problem seemed to be gone, but the translation was terrible. Like, Google-translate level terrible. Why not just ask some community people to help translate it, instead of using some crappy computer-generated translation?

Although I realize that making a game is not easy and the game is pretty cheap, I would not recommend this game to anyone I know. Sorry.

reviewText:
It's not good at all, plain and simple. The only redeeming feature about this game is that, for the price and access to trading cards, you can feasibly idle and get a profit off of it.

Gameplay usually consists of navigating poorly lit areas in simple Point A to B fashion, and the run function is bugged to the point that you will tediously walk at all times. Jump scares are weak and at times usually indistinguishable aside from the obvious audio cues. There is no threat of death.

Audio and visual resources are nothing special at all. The art assets are cheap and mediocre and characters are poorly drawn. Scare cues are stock, and they even use a text-to-voice tool for the odd voice clip.

The plot is stupid, the writing treats you like an idiot, it all feels as if it should be tongue-in-cheek. But it isn't.

It's all very tacky and very cheap and impossible to recommend, even as a joke purchase.
